fieldsOfStudy: Anti-Money Laundering and Financial Crimes, Human Rights Law, Immigration
educations.schoolName: The George Washington University Law School

headline: Assistant Chief Counsel - Office of Chief Counsel - Denver at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

defaultPosition.title: Assistant Chief Counsel - Office of Chief Counsel - Denver

positions.title: Assistant Chief Counsel - Office of Chief Counsel - Denver
Law Clerk for the Office of Chief Counsel - Arlington
Special Assistant to the Deputy Director

positions.description:
- Provide research and analytic support to senior leadership for the division of DHS responsible for investigating immigration crime, human rights violations and human smuggling; smuggling of narcotics, weapons and other types of contraband; financial crimes; cybercrime and export enforcement issues. The division is also responsible for conducting investigations aimed at protecting critical infrastructure industries that are vulnerable to sabotage, attack or exploitation. 

- Lead annual Strategic Risk Assessment, surveying agents (over 6700 special agents assigned to more than 200 cities throughout the U.S. and 47 countries) from the domestic and international operations, program offices, office of intelligence, and senior leadership to determine the agencyâs priority mission areas. 

- Analyze agentsâ performance with respect to arrests, indictments, and convictions in addition to drug, arms, and monetary seizures. 

- Review on-going investigations to determine whether to dedicate greater resources to their efforts.
positions.title: Mission Support Specialist

positions.companyName: Homeland Security Investigations Law Division, ICE, DHS
positions.description:
- Support the Human Rights Violators and War Crimes Center in research and review of data about illicit financial dealings, including money laundering, fraud, and narcotics trafficking, by individuals within the United States that were linked to the support of death squads and other human rights violations abroad.   

- Support the Criminal Law Section by researching statutes and case law that can be used to assist in the seizure and forfeiture of virtual currency.

- Support the Criminal Law Section by researching the use of the Iraqi Dinar to conceal the proceeds of Specified Unlawful Activities.

- Support the Criminal Law Section by developing a legal strategy to hold corporations liable for commercial fraud with respect to import duties.
positions.title: Law Clerk
